240.question: What was the performance of both approaches on their dataset?
240.response: {'Answer': 'The i-vector system trained on VoxCeleb and evaluated on the CN-Celeb(E) evaluation set achieved an EER of 17.43% while the x-vector system trained on VoxCeleb and evaluated on the CN-Celeb(E) evaluation set achieved an EER of 14.78%.'}
240.answer: ERR of 19.05 with i-vectors and 15.52 with x-vectors

242.question: What genres are covered?
242.response: {'Answer': 'The genres covered are entertainment, interview, singing, play, movie, vlog, live broadcast, speech, drama, recitation and advertisement.'}
242.answer: genre, entertainment, interview, singing, play, movie, vlog, live broadcast, speech, drama, recitation and advertisement

244.question: Which of the two speech recognition models works better overall on CN-Celeb?
244.response: {'Answer': 'The i-vector system trained on VoxCeleb and evaluated on CN-Celeb(E) has a slightly better EER than the x-vector system trained on VoxCeleb and evaluated on CN-Celeb(E) (15.05% vs 15.52%).'}

245.question: By how much is performance on CN-Celeb inferior to performance on VoxCeleb?
245.response: {'Answer': 'Performance on CN-Celeb is 15.52% while performance on VoxCeleb is 4.78%. Therefore, performance on CN-Celeb is 15.52 - 4.78 = 10.74% inferior to performance on VoxCeleb.'}
245.answer: For i-vector system, performances are 11.75% inferior to voxceleb. For x-vector system, performances are 10.74% inferior to voxceleb
